line_1: HOW easy was Colin, how blithe and how gay!
line_2: Ere he met the fair Chloris, how sprightly his lay!

line_1: Ere he met the fair Chloris, how sprightly his lay!
line_2: HOW easy was Colin, how blithe and how gay!

line_1: So graceful her form, so accomplish'd her mind,
line_2: Sure pity, he thought, with such charms must be join'd!

line_1: Sure pity, he thought, with such charms must be join'd!
line_2: So graceful her form, so accomplish'd her mind,

line_1: Whenever she danc'd, or whenever she sung,
line_2: How just was her motion, how sweet was her tongue!

line_1: How just was her motion, how sweet was her tongue!
line_2: Whenever she danc'd, or whenever she sung,

line_1: And when the youth told her his passionate flame,
line_2: She allow'd him to fancy her heart felt the same.

line_1: She allow'd him to fancy her heart felt the same.
line_2: And when the youth told her his passionate flame,

line_1: With ardour he press'd her to think him sincere,
line_2: But alas! she redoubled each hope and each fear;

line_1: But alas! she redoubled each hope and each fear;
line_2: With ardour he press'd her to think him sincere,

line_1: She would not deny, nor she would not approve,
line_2: And she neither refus'd him, nor gave him her love.

line_1: And she neither refus'd him, nor gave him her love.
line_2: She would not deny, nor she would not approve,

line_1: Now cheer'd by complacence, now froze by disdain,
line_2: He languish'd for freedom, but languish'd in vain:

line_1: He languish'd for freedom, but languish'd in vain:
line_2: Now cheer'd by complacence, now froze by disdain,

line_1: 'Till Thyrsis, who pity'd so helpless a slave,
line_2: Eas'd his heart of its pain by the counsel he gave.

line_1: Eas'd his heart of its pain by the counsel he gave.
line_2: 'Till Thyrsis, who pity'd so helpless a slave,

line_1: Forsake her, said he, and reject her awhile;
line_2: If she love you, she soon will return with a smile:

line_1: If she love you, she soon will return with a smile:
line_2: Forsake her, said he, and reject her awhile;

line_1: You can judge of her passion by absence alone,
line_2: And by absence will conquer her heart or — your own.

line_1: And by absence will conquer her heart or — your own.
line_2: You can judge of her passion by absence alone,

line_1: This advice he pursu'd; but the remedy prov'd
line_2: Too fatal, alas, to the fair one he lov'd;

line_1: Too fatal, alas, to the fair one he lov'd;
line_2: This advice he pursu'd; but the remedy prov'd

line_1: Which cur'd his own passion, but left her in vain
line_2: To sigh for a heart she could never regain.

line_1: To sigh for a heart she could never regain.
line_2: Which cur'd his own passion, but left her in vain

line_1: WHEN Colin's good dame, who long held him a tug,
line_2: And defeated his hopes by the help of the jug,

line_1: And defeated his hopes by the help of the jug,
line_2: WHEN Colin's good dame, who long held him a tug,

line_1: Had taken too freely the cheeruping cup,
line_2: And repeated the dose till it laid her quite up;

line_1: And repeated the dose till it laid her quite up;
line_2: Had taken too freely the cheeruping cup,

line_1: Colin sent for the doctor: with sorrowful face
line_2: He gave him his fee, and he told him her case.

line_1: He gave him his fee, and he told him her case.
line_2: Colin sent for the doctor: with sorrowful face

line_1: Quoth Galen, I'll do what I can for your wife;
line_2: But indeed she's so bad, that I fear, for her life.

line_1: But indeed she's so bad, that I fear, for her life.
line_2: Quoth Galen, I'll do what I can for your wife;

line_1: In counsel there's safety — e'en send for another;
line_2: For if she shou'd die, folks will make a strange pother,

line_1: For if she shou'd die, folks will make a strange pother,
line_2: In counsel there's safety — e'en send for another;

line_1: And say that I lost her for want of good skill —
line_2: Or of better advice — or, in short, what they will.

line_1: Or of better advice — or, in short, what they will.
line_2: And say that I lost her for want of good skill —

line_1: Says Colin, your judgment there's none can dispute;
line_2: And if physic can cure her — I know yours will do't.

line_1: And if physic can cure her — I know yours will do't.
line_2: Says Colin, your judgment there's none can dispute;

line_1: But if, after all, she shou'd happen to die,
line_2: And they say that you kill'd her — I'll swear 'tis a lye:

line_1: And they say that you kill'd her — I'll swear 'tis a lye:
line_2: But if, after all, she shou'd happen to die,

line_1: 'Tis the husband's chief business, whatever ensue;
line_2: And whoever finds fault — I'll be shot — if I do.

line_1: And whoever finds fault — I'll be shot — if I do.
line_2: 'Tis the husband's chief business, whatever ensue;
